turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: Goddamnit, why do they do that?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: How do I find them?  Their offices are empty.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: They own the whole building.  They just move from floor to floor.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: They know you... you worked for them. You can get me in.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: No, I can't.  I'm sorry and all, but...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Tell them the cops are after you... tell them you've got to talk to someone, I'm threatening to blow the whistle.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: What whistle?  There's no fucking whistle.  This is fucking dangerous.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Drive in.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: What are you gonna do anyway?  You won't get your money back.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I don't want money.  I'm pulling back the curtain.  I'm here to meet the wizard.

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: You don't need me...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Shut up.  Cuff him to the rail.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: I told you, they hired me over the phone.  I never met anyone.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Where'd you pick up your checks?

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: It was a different floor then...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Guess!

turns.speaker: FEINGOLD
turns.text: Like, this way... sort of...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I need the police.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Let's get you dried off first.  I might have some clothes below.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: You know, these fit... perfectly.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: They were my husband's.  My late husband... may he rest in peace.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: I've been so lonely.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I can't tell you how <u>not</u> interested I am.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Don't be nervous.  They said you'd be nervous.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Don't take another step.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Isn't this what you like?  They told me you had a thing for boats.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: First they try to kill me, now you?  Put your damn clothes back on.

turns.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
turns.text: Ah, Mr. Van Orton.  Here you go...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Have we met?

turns.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
turns.text: Show Mr. Van Orton to his room.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: The key?

turns.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
turns.text: Hm?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Is there a room key?

turns.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
turns.text: Didn't I give you two?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: No, you didn't...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Have a nice day.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Dinner's in the oven.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Thank you.  Goodnight.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: You did?  How is he?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Okay.  I think he's into some sort of new personal improvement cult.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Well... send my love, if you see him again.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Is everything alright?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: I've finished for the evening.  Will you be needing anything else?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: No, thank you.  Goodnight.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Goodnight then.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Mr. Van Orton... ?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Ilsa... you're alright?

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Yes. What do you mean?  What's wrong?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Did the alarm go off?  The house... they... you didn't see... ?

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.  What's happened?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: There's been a break in.  Lock this door and stay here.  Don't move a muscle.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: What makes you ask?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: All the time I've known you, you've never once asked about him.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: He came to my mind recently, that's all.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Your mother thought he was a good man.  He worked very hard.  What I remember most was his manner was so... slight.  It was easy to spend time in a room, and not realize he'd been there the whole time.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Was he morose, or...?  I mean...

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: No.  What happened... no one expected it.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Sometimes I wonder how much of him there is in me.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Not much, I think.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I'm just like him.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: You're not like him at all.  I don't know exactly what's going on around here lately, but don't make me start worrying about you.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Did you worry about him?

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Nobody worried about your father.

turns.speaker: ILSA
turns.text: Goodnight.  See you home.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Goodnight.  Where was she?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: What's the trouble?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: You're here for Conrad Van Orton? I'm the hotel manager...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Pleasure to meet you, I'd like to see my brother, thank you.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Your brother.  Will you come with me?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: What's this about?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: It's a private matter, for you... I think you'll be more comfortable...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Where's my brother?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: There were complaints by other guests, and damage to his room.  We did the best we could to accommodate his behavior.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: His behavior... ?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: He couldn't, or refused to pay.  We extended credit...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Look, where is he?!

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: There was an incident a few days ago... a nervous breakdown, they said.  The police took him.  They left this address, in case anyone...

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Invitations: the Museum Gala.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: The Fitzwilliam Botanical Garden Annual Fundraiser.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: The Hinchberger wedding.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Let me think...  Hordes of men in tuxedos.  Everyone's droning.  Ludwell's trying to break the ice by reciting an off-color limerick...

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: I'll send your regrets.  Honestly, why must I even bother?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Because, if you don't know about society, you don't have the satisfaction of avoiding it.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Your ex-wife.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I know who she is.  Take a message.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I don't like her.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: I wouldn't mention the following, except he was very insistent.  It's obviously some sort of prank...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: A gentleman left a message requesting a lunch, but I assured him...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: What gentleman, Maria?

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: A Mister... Seymour Butts.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: "Under the Bleachers"... by Seymour Butts.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Pardon me?  I'm afraid I don't...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Cancel lunch.  Make reservations at Campton Place for me and Mr. Butts.

turns.speaker: PLUMP GUY
turns.text: What the fuck... ?!

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Why are you following me?

turns.speaker: PLUMP GUY
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.  I'm just driving...

turns.speaker: PLUMP GUY
turns.text: Look... what I'm doing is none of your business...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Is Alan Baer "the Game?"  Is that what this is?

turns.speaker: PLUMP GUY
turns.text: Friend... why don't you back off.

turns.speaker: PLUMP GUY
turns.text: Hey... !

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Nice touch.  Does the game use real bullets... ?

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: Anything wrong... ?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Nothing.  Nothing at all.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I wasn't expecting you.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: Wanted to wish you luck.  Not that you'll need it.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: Attractive...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Don't ask.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: I checked it personally.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: What's happened...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Follow me.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: Nicholas...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: That you've involved Conrad... is unforgivable.  I am now your enemy.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: How concerned should I be?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It was a misunderstanding.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Someone's playing hardball.  It's complicated.  Can I ask a favor?

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: You know you can.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Find out about a company called C.R.S.  Consumer Recreation Services.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: Sounds like they make tennis rackets. What do we know?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Just what I told you.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: Nothing else?

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Christ... I can't believe it... invisible ink?

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: You're joking.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: It's what they do.  It's like... being toyed with by a bunch of...  Depraved children.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: Very well.  If you tell me not to worry, I shan't.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Sam...  Thank you.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: He hasn't called back.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: What about the house?

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: Illegal surveillance, reckless endangerment...

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Attempted murder.

turns.speaker: SUTHERLAND
turns.text: Bravo, young man.  you have to tell me what this was all about sometime.  I want you to know... when it looked there for awhile like you were going slowly insane... I was fully prepared to have you committed to the <u>finest</u> mental-health facility available.  I mean that sincerely, don't thank me.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: You warm my heart.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Hi.  I'm Todd Aubochon.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Greetings fellow insomniac.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Greetings fellow sheep counter.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: These old Victorian houses are great, aren't they?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It's not Victorian, everyone thinks that the whole nineteenth century was Victorian.  This is gothic, this is English Craftsman, this is Romanesque.  This is... insane.  Who lives here?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You know what I love about wine that comes in bottles like this?

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: <u>Every</u> year is a good year.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Hi, Luke Sanderson, bad sleeper, I'm your basic tosser-turner, and you are...

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Uh... Nell Vance...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: And what kind of sleeper?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Well, I... uh...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Obsessive worrier.  Join the club.  And you?  I'd guess...

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I only saw Theo drive up.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Who's Watts?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: The children.  The children Hugh Crain built the house for.  The children he never had.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Come on.  These are the typically sentimental gestures of a depraved industrialist.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Couldn't get the last ones.  You?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I did okay.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Welcome Home Eleanor.  Welcome Home?  I've never been here.  Who did this?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It's somebody's idea of a joke.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Modelling small-group dynamics in the formation of narrative hallucinations.  You brought us here to scare us.  Insomnia, that was just a decoy issue.  You're disgusting.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Is this true?  I've been hypnotized?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: And this is my assistant, Mary Lambretta.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Greetings.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: So why did you need the Addam's Family mansion for a scientific test?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: I thought it best to be isolated, to be in a location with a definite sense of history, and I wanted to make sure that it wasn't so pleasant you'd all sleep too easily.  You'll be taking a variety of tests, none of them harmful, and you've got the house, the grounds, and each other to keep you company.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: That could have been worse.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Luke, can I talk to you?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Because... well, I know I can trust you.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: I've read your tests.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Do you need me anymore?  Cause I'm going to bed.  They can stay up talking another 45 minutes if they want, but I gotta try to get some sleep.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: And those are Luke's and mine.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: There's a carriage house around back.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: I gave my key to the gate to Todd, but the Dudleys'll be here in the morning.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Do we still get paid for the week?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: You get your money.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Is that the question of compassion or science?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: It's a question.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: She got the child labor stuff from me.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It's not going to hold your weight.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Just stay there, Nell!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You're not telling us something.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Watts.  Those were his keys Nell found.  His roommate called and said Watts left when he was supposed to.  I think he's here.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: The rest of you may hate your insomnia, but I find it the best time of the day for me.  I'm alone.  Nobody's talking to me but myself.  My mind is racing with ideas, and I can think.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Nah, you're going crazy with doubt, all of your mistakes are coming back up the pipes, and it's worse than a nightmare. --

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: He said that Hugh Crain... Hugh Crain was a monster.  He said that he was a brutal, horrible man.  He told me that Crain drove his workers to early deaths.  Crain had children chained to the looms in his mill.  And listen to this: his beautiful Rene killed herself.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: And why didn't Marrow tell <u>us</u>? Doesn't he trust women?  That fuck.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Hey!  I heard screaming...

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Luke.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Well, this lot is full!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He must have left.  Didn't like the looks of the place or something.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I didn't do it.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You could have.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: So could you!  Is this some fucked up idea of art, putting someone else's name to a painting?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Mister very talky, would you please say what it is about this study that bothers you?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: The whole thing feels like experimental misdirection.  Like he says it's about one thing, a psychological profile of environmental effects on insomnia... and that'd be a legitimate study, but I think that we've been subjected to an academic bait and switch; he's really looking at something else.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: We're fucked.  We're in a haunted house and we can't get out until the morning.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You don't really believe it's haunted... Do you believe in ghosts?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That depends on your definition of ghosts.  I'm going to check on her, and then I'm going to stay awake.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: All night?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You want company?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Maybe someday.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You used the wrong test.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Will the two of you shut up!  God damn it!  Maybe the tests were right, Marrow.  She's sensitive, she's vulnerable, but I don't think she's suicidal and I didn't have to test her.  Maybe she wasn't trying to kill herself. Maybe she was really scared. Maybe she really heard voices.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nell --

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: -- how much is this car worth?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Was sure she'd be in here.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Where in the hell can she be.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nell!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: We can't stay here looking for her.  She doesn't want to be found...

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: It's still an electric shock!

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Come on Malcolm, it's only seven ohms, it's nothing, it's like a joy buzzer!  And it's not about the pain, it's about the interference with concentration...

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Malcolm, this is essential work I'm doing.  Just think what my research can do for education. Elementary school classrooms near train tracks or airports, where loud noise is random; this helps to prove the need for sound insulation if the children are ever going to learn to read.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: And that will be a good place to end this study.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: No, Malcolm!  Individual performance is only part of it.  I know why baseball players choke for no reason, I know why violinists throw up with fear before every concert, and need to, to give a great performance, but what I want to know is, how fear works in a group...

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Not the way you've constructed your group, it's just not ethical!

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: But if the group knows it's being studied as a group, you contaminate the results.  The deception is minor.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Are you working with her?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Mary, I'll meet you outside.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Why are you working with her? Mary Lambretta was thrown out of the department for trying to get a Ph.D. in psychic studies.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: And after she was thrown out, she needed a job.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You don't believe in the paranormal.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: No, but she does, and that's all that matters.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Does she know that's why you're using her?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I, I just can't...

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: She needed a job, Malcolm.  And she's smart.  And she helps me.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I have a bad feeling about what you're doing.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: This is the last chapter.  Please, please give me clearance.  It's for science.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Eleanor, how was the drive?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: You can call me Nell, Dr. Marrow.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Nell.  Good enough.  And I'm Jim.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I'm really... honored to be part of this study, Jim.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Well... we're glad to have you.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: You wrote that you had trouble sleeping.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Yes, because someone was always keeping me awake.  Ever since I was little.  That was my job.  I took care of my mother and I had to be there for her all night long, and she woke up all the time.  And after she died, well, it's been a few months, but I still, I still wake up, it's... a habit.  I know we've only known each other a couple of hours, but I'm really glad to be with people who let me talk about this.  I'm really happy to be here with you.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: All the carvings.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: But there's a sad catch to the story.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: The cold sensation.  Who felt it first?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Theo I think.  You've asked us that three times, Doctor Marrow. What's going on?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: How do you feel about Luke's suggestion that it was just the old plumbing?  Water hammer, something like that?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: For an American you do a good imitation of the British at their most apologetic.  Pardon me.  Excuse me, sorry, sorry...

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Nell!  What's wrong?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: That smell... oh, God.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: What did it smell like?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: It was very specific.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: All right...

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: In the bathroom in my mother's room, the toilet was next to an old wooden table.  It smelled like that wood.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: So... smell... is... Smell is the sense that triggers the most powerful memories.  And a memory can trigger a smell.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I wasn't thinking about my mother's bathroom.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: What happened after you smelled it?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I looked at Theo.  She had a look on her face.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Like she smelled it too?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: And then what happened?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I got more scared.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Hmm.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm messing up the study.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: No you're not.  Something moved you.  You saw something.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Are you coming to confess?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: I wish I were.  I wish I had done it, then I could confess and you'd be at peace.  That great moral philosopher Frank Sinatra once said to someone he loved, I wish you had an enemy, so I could beat him up.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Let's say it wasn't you.  Who did it?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: It was a stupid thing to do.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: It was.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Welcome Home.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: You'll never see it again.  Mr. Dudley's taking care of it.  I'm sorry, Nell.  Can I show you something you'd like to see?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Someone is playing with you.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: It doesn't matter.  Even if they're tormenting me, someone wants me.  What I do with this is up to me.  I can be a victim, or I can be a volunteer.  And I want to be the volunteer.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: What is that tune?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I don't know.  A lullaby I guess. My mother used to hum it to me. And her mother before that, and so on.  Hugh Crain, would you care to dance?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Nell... please, Nell... take a deep breath...

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: And they're all locked together in here... and he won't let go of them!

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: I hadn't done a study of how group fear affects individual performance.  Mass hysteria is like a story, Nell.  A communal story.  Someone starts it.  Then we all add a little more to it. And then for some reason -- no one knows how -- we start believing it.  This story shapes what we see and hear.  We interpret everything through it, make it fit the story. I started our story when I gave you the history of Hill House. You've added to it.  That's what this experiment has all been about.  That's what it was about, the experiment's over.  I'm pulling the plug.  This is my fault.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: It's not real?  Crain?  He's not real?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Why would we want to do that, Nell?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Because that's where he burned them up, the child laborers from his mills! Because that's where their bones are! He killed hundreds. He took them here and he killed them. Their bones are in the fireplace!

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: The children want me.  They're calling me.  They need me.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Nell.  You will come here now.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: But you told me to look in the paper!  You told me I'd be perfect!

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Nell, the first time I ever spoke with you in person was the night we met here.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Then who called me?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: My mother used to hum this to me. Like her mother hummed it to her. And my great grandmother Carolyn hummed it to her.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: What'll happen to us, Nell?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Nothing, if you leave right now. There's a war going on all around us.  Don't get in the way, please.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You know what he's really upset about?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You're going to publish, he's going to perish... And why did you hire me for this?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: You hear the vibrations in the wire.  There's a magnetic pulse in the wires, you feel it.  I could test it.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Test it.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Yes, this is Doctor Marrow.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: How'd I know it was for you?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Because it's my phone.  Yes... Mrs. Dudley, just leave the boxes inside, thank you.  See you soon.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Here's how they're organized. Groups of five, very different personalities: scored all over the Kiersey Temperament Sorter just like you asked for.  And they all score high on the insomnia charts.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Good.
